posts.title: Officially lost my Dad to TDS
posts.content:
After a blowout argument about 6 years back, we stopped talking. Eventually, I (stupidly) made efforts to reach out and reconnect because I love him. He's my Dad.

Fast forward 4 years and my wife and I have our first child, then our second. I had hoped becoming a grandfather would soften his a heart. We continued to not talk politics.

The other day he sent me an article from the WSJ on how the Trump Tax Cuts negatively affected people. I said, "No thanks, I don't trust the WSJ." A few days later I shared this cartoon (https://patriots.win/p/19Adl7A9Kv) to our family group chat and he responded that sometimes we need to go to war like in the Revolutionary War, WW2.. and to stop Putin! I politely disagreed and stated it's not our problem. We should look out for ourselves. He used the "learn your history" argument fallacy and told me to get my news from more "neutral sources." This eventually devolved into him insulting me and bringing up my past fascination with conspiracy theories (which means I'm dumb!) and finally he started threatening me to stop responding "or else".

Unless he has some spiritual epiphany, we're done. I've lost my Dad.

The sadness in my heart was initially overwhelming. I've always wanted to be a good son, and have tried to be the grown-up in the room, as it were. The last things I said were that I still loved him, and wished him the best, but emotions and insults have no place in a healthy political debate (again, my bad for thinking that's what we were engaging in).

My sadness has been replaced in the last few days with righteous anger and a renewed pride in what I truly know is best for my family, and my country. I keep hope that he will see the light, but I fear he will continue to side with the most retarded and dangerous political party I've ever seen. He is quadruple boosted so he likely won't be around much longer. When I think about that, I have to fight myself to not feel intense sorrow, and I hate myself for still loving him.

Thanks for reading.

The other day he sent me an article from the WSJ on how the Trump Tax Cuts negatively affected people. I said, "No thanks, I don't trust the WSJ." A few days later I shared this cartoon (https://patriots.win/p/19Adl7A9Kv) to our family group chat and he responded that sometimes we need to go to war like in the Revolutionary War, WW2.. and to stop Putin! I politely disagreed and stated it's not our problem. We should look out for ourselves. He used the "learn your history" argument fallacy and told me to get my news from more "neutral sources." The sadness in my heart was initially overwhelming. I've always wanted to be a good son, and have tried to be the grown-up in the room, as it were. Musk: There are still almost twice as many credit/purchasing cards as people in the government, and the limits are $10,000! 

A lot of shady expenditures happening.
posts.author: rdvs34283

quotedTweet.content:
Weekly Credit Card Update!

Pilot program has been expanded to 16 agencies to audit unused/unneeded credit cards. After 2 weeks, ~146,000 cards have been de-activated.

As a reminder, at the start of the audit, there were ~4.6M active cards/accounts, so still more work to do.

twitter.content:
There are still almost twice as many credit/purchasing cards as people in the government, and the limits are $10,000! 

A lot of shady expenditures happening.
